website_summaries.verdict: If you want robust tea and have a Keurig, chances are you will enjoy this classic blend and how easy it is to make and enjoy.
pros: Owners of Keurig brewing systems can't get enough of this English breakfast blend crafted with black tea from Twinings of London that's been making tea since the 1700s
cons: The flavor may be too bold for tea drinkers that prefer a milder taste
Some tea enthusiasts prefer the traditional method of brewing

customer_reviews.title: All good reviews are fake!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for a good chai tea. But after trying this my only conclusion is that all the good reviews are fake. First day I tried a large cup and it tasted like dirty water. I’m like okay let’s try a normal size tomorrow. Next day I try the medium 8oz size. Still tastes like dirty water. At this point I’m getting worried and immediately try the smallest 6oz option. Even that tastes like dirty water. No flavor. More like actual dirt mixed with hot water.
customer_reviews.author: KCV

customer_reviews.title: Beware of What Your Buying
customer_reviews.text: This was a very poor excuse for French Vanilla Chai Lattr. The was no flavorful armona when it was brewing and when I was done it look like a very pale mudpuddle. The taste was horrible and the flavor was awful. So since I was stuck with 11 of these little pale ghost of French Vanilla Chai Latte. So this is what I did. Use 1/2 cup of bottle water in my Keurig, Add 1 cup of Bolthouse Vanilla Chi Tea. stir and drink. It is not how I want to use my Bolthouse but it works and it makes the tea drinkable.
customer_reviews.author: ShadowofRavelyn

customer_reviews.title: Love this Chai tea!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Keurig and am a coffee drinker but sometimes tea just sounds good. When those times come, I reach for this Chai tea. It's comforting to drink, kinda like being wrapped in a warm and cozy blanket. It's very smooth and you can taste all the spices but they are not over powering. I add a little stevia to mine along with some cream. This coffee drinker would definitely recommend this Chai tea for a nice warm hug on cold day.
customer_reviews.author: Love 2 Read Novels

customer_reviews.title: I always come back to Twinings
customer_reviews.text: I think I have tried all of the unsweetened tea K-Cups for ICED tea available in my area plus many via online purchase, and these are the best I've tried. I always come back to these. They have the best, closest-to-home-brewed flavor that I've found to make my iced tea. I like a sturdy tea flavor - none of this colored water for me. Twinings set to 10-ounces brewed over ice makes a strong glass of iced tea that remains full-flavored even as the ice melts.
customer_reviews.author: Robin AlwineTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works with my Keurig 2.0
customer_reviews.text: I recently received a Keurig 2.0. I ordered these without knowing of the issues with some Kcups not working with the 2.0 I was anxious to see it it worked when it came and I was very happy to see that it does work!! The tea is delicious and I drink one every morning!
customer_reviews.author: Erica Inez

customer_reviews.title: Update from prior 3-star review
customer_reviews.text: The company must have fixed their manufacturing issues as I haven't had any problems with this order of K-cups. Keep up the good work and I'll keep buying. The tea itself is really good but the filter inside several of the pods evidently wasn't secured to the pod case. I've gotten a mouthful of ground up tea leaves in several cups and that's not at all enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: KC8RXQ

customer_reviews.title: More like apple chamomile without any spices
customer_reviews.text: I have to wonder if this tea is mislabeled because this tea tastes like apple chamomile tea without any spices, maybe a bit of hibiscus. I double-checked the packaging and it definitely says Winter Spice. I was expecting cinnamon, maybe allspice, cloves, ginger etc but I can't taste any spice in this tea at all. It does have a very strong chamomile scent that is unmistakable. It isn't terrible, but definitely not at all what I was expecting. I'm going back to my favorite Good Earth Sweet and Spicy Caffeine Free Herbal Tea. I had been looking to switch it up a bit so I don't get sick of the Good Earth.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dill

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: I like Twinings teas generally, but these French Vanilla Chai Latte pods are horrible. Horrible! The beverage is so watery, it has very little taste no matter what size mug or how much water you use in your Keurig. I would have assumed I got a defective product (maybe they forgot to add ingredients to the pods?), except other reviewers have had the same complaint. I really should have paid attention to negative reviews before ordering. LISTEN TO THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS.
customer_reviews.author: ac

customer_reviews.title: Weakest, thinnest chai tea ever
customer_reviews.text: I usually love Twinings teas, but this was an epic fail. The 1st cup I made was 10 oz. It was like flavored water. The second cup I tried was on the 8 oz. setting. Not much difference, still way too weak. The final cup I tried was to open a kcup and dump it in my mug and then fix it as usual using another kcup on the 8 oz. setting. This was a huge mistake on my part. The tea did not dissolve like I had hoped. Oh well, live and learn. The remaining 8 pods are now in the office breakroom.
customer_reviews.author: Amandabrarian

customer_reviews.title: What a great disappointment!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy to receive my Amazon order yesterday..... I finally had my Twining’s Lemon & Ginger flavor herbal tea pods !!! Made my first cup this morning..... Wow !!! What a great disappointment!!! What I noticed first was the wonderful aroma, then I took my first sip...... Yuck !!! There was no flavor, no taste at all.... what a great disappointment !!! Where was the spiced lemon taste they said it had ??? I even tried a second pod thinking maybe the first one was a fluke, but no... there still wasn’t any flavor, just yuck tasting hot water.... like I said.... what a great disappointment...
customer_reviews.author: Bogleha52

customer_reviews.title: Not taste and it’s clear
customer_reviews.text: This product does not have any taste is lake water with milk and cinnamon I tried to used brewed in the smallest amount to the difference but notch’s ve the favor is not there. It was a waste of time and my money. It does not have any smell and it does not taste good.
customer_reviews.author: Esmirna encarnacion

customer_reviews.title: Great tea. We go through a box or 2 every month
customer_reviews.text: Love the tea but the design of the bottom of the K cup seems to cause an occasional failure because the bottom needle dose not pierce the bottom of the cup fully. He good firm insert solves the problem 99 percent of the time. The cup on the left is the Tea cup bottom, the one on the right is another type of base. Both cups have about the same thickness of material ( .01 inch ) but the one on the right is much easier to insert and fails less often.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - great balance of lemon and ginger with convenience of K Cups
customer_reviews.text: Seriously I'm still drinking my first cup after opening the box and couldn't wait to write the review. If you like ginger and enjoy lemon in your tea, then this is something you've got to try. If you're looking for ordinary lemon tea taste then this isn't your cuppa tea. The balance is about even between lemon and ginger, and the combination of the two gives a sum that's greater than its parts. I just love it. Tip: With K Cup teas, press the "strong" button on your Keurig before starting it. Okay gotta go now so I can finish this tea before it gets cold.
customer_reviews.author: Fun2Drum

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: Truly as good as if you brewed your own. After returning from a trip from the UK I was craving a good cup and this fit the bill. Try it if you like a good cup of tea. *FYI if you every see a review that says they received an item FREE in exchange for a review DO NOT TRUST IT! These people are asked to LIE. I know because I use to receive these items and they told me POINT BLANK never to post a bad reviews. I asked to be remove from the program. THIS IS NOT ONE OF THOSE ITEMS. I BOUGHT THIS, and I am happy with this item.
customer_reviews.author: The Tam'ster

customer_reviews.title: It says chai latte but definitely doesn't taste like it
customer_reviews.text: Ok I have been a tea drinker all my life but the Keurig tea/coffee thing is new to me. Chai tea/lattes that I have been drinking for years are very pleasantly aromatic and delicious. This is my first time trying this variant. The Aruna is not what I would call pleasantly aromatic not does it taste delicious. The aroma reminds me of strong cleaning chemicals and the taste leaves way too much to be desired as well as it leaving a rather unpleasant after taste. My recommendation is to drink elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: barbara

customer_reviews.title: Good tea for a K- cup
customer_reviews.text: Probably the most affordable tea K-Cups out there. I like the taste of this tea and I can get a second cup using the "strong" setting on my machine. Us tea drinkers always get shortchanged, so I was happy to find this deal.
customer_reviews.author: SDM120

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, great tea flavor, my new favorite!
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a fan of Twinings English breakfast tea but had never had the Irish tea, so I wanted to give it a try. But, I had this impression in my mind that the Irish tea was going to be much stronger, more bitter, with a synapse-frying dose of caffeine. So I was very pleasantly surprised by how smooth this tea was for me. I admit I do take the edge off my morning tea with a bit of sugar, but I love this tea. I drink a variety of teas -- English, Earl Grey, green, oolong, Jasmine. I think this Irish tea has jumped up to the top of my list!
customer_reviews.author: Dave M

customer_reviews.title: Not very impressive.
customer_reviews.text: As a brand new Keurig owner I was excited to try these out although I really honestly believe that the Keurig individual disposable Keurig cups are not compostable and therefore a waste I thought I'd try it out anyway. turns out it's not great quality of tea leaf although it is loose leaf I will at least give them that. be honest I could get better teeth stronger t higher-quality with just using a reusable Keurig cup or buying from another supplier with compostable cups. For those two reasons I'm not buying again but the the tea tasted fine.
customer_reviews.author: Nadia Reigna Silver

customer_reviews.title: I am a tea connoisseur.
customer_reviews.text: Growing up in Toronto, Ontario, Canada ( I was born in West Seattle) tea became my hot beverage of choice. I learned early on that I liked earl gray tea. I also learned all earl gray teas were not the same. It was easy to tell Twinings Earl Gray was the best and consistently stays the same high quality. When my Keurig pods arrive, they are always in good shape. I am very happy with this product! A china cup is necessary.
customer_reviews.author: lydia1

customer_reviews.title: Weak and ashy herbal tea
customer_reviews.text: I love herbal infusions, especially fresh lemon and ginger. That's not practical in my office, though, so I got these lemon ginger k-cups. I had tried the ones from Stash before, and they are delicious. I tried this, and it's... not delicious. I mean, I can drink it, but I don't enjoy it. It doesn't smell bad. It doesn't taste good. It's brownish gray, weak, and tastes a little earthy/ashy. There is a hint of lemon and ginger, which is its only redeeming factor. In case it was due to a faulty machine, I tried it at home, too. Both machines yield the same result. I won't be getting this again.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Best K-cup Green Tea
customer_reviews.text: Twinings produce an all round quality product. They go back a long way in Britain's tea consumption history. Their K-cup has an accurate presentation of green tea aroma and flavor in your cup. If you're a fan of green tea I think you will enjoy this one. If you like black tea their English Breakfast tea is the best.
customer_reviews.author: JDR

customer_reviews.title: Yum.
customer_reviews.text: I drink a cup of this stuff every night with a small spoonful of honey mixed in for sweetness. It’s part of my night time routine that I look forward to. One of the better sleepy time teas that I’ve tried. Can’t say that it actually makes me drowsy whatsoever so don’t expect it to work like a sleeping pill. It’s just a nice caffeine free tea option for evenings!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Brown

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get tea bagged by this product... use a tea bag
customer_reviews.text: It’s an ok product but completely unnecessary to buy in a k-cup package... it takes as much time to use a tea bag and press the hot water dispenser on your Keurig. Expensive vs a tea bag and the tea bag makes a better cup of tea with no plastic involved.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Keagle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I am an Earl Grey tea lover and I must say this product being decaffeinated has no bearing on it's flavorful and delicious taste. I am addicted!! Having to stop my morning cup of coffee was hard until I tried Twinings. Now I don't even think about coffee. If you love an awesome cup of black tea with a hint of bergamont this is the brand you should try!! You won't be disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Carole Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Improve shipping methods BUT great KCup tea
customer_reviews.text: Love getting this product on subscribe and save. Sadly every time I get this product the KCup box always comes crushed. This will result in a few cups crushed and unusable. Would highly recommend shipping in a box as to avoid bag crushing. The tea however is amazing just as strong as the bag most of the time. I even leave it in and use it again later that day and it still taste fine. So happy my favorite tea is in Kcup.
customer_reviews.author: BNX21

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee ever.  Eight oClock, medium roast, Columbian
customer_reviews.text: We prefer a Medium Roast coffee. Eight O’Clock Columbian Peaks fills that need. We use Keurig K Cups in a Keurig appliance. Both are terrific. Pricing from Amazon is good and I intend to buy this coffee, both regular and now decaf as well. Not too strong- just right. Comes in boxes that fit my pantry. Except for one seller who uses shipping tape to fasten all the boxes together. I watch for that name before I place my order.
customer_reviews.author: Southern

customer_reviews.title: Didn't know how good it would be
customer_reviews.text: We had only used our single serve maker for coffee, so this was our first experience with tea. It's just wonderful. Making tea the "traditional" ways (loose or in a tea bag) often has variable results depending on the steeping time. But this produces a quick beverage at a consistent strength that suits our palates.
customer_reviews.author: Evansthecat

customer_reviews.title: Delicious treat!
customer_reviews.text: I just love Twinings Chai Latte Tea! The taste is sweet without being too sweet. It gives you that little extra nudge to wake you up in the morning. I did try to keep it in my cupboard so I could have a cup every day. However, I can't do that. It's just too pricey. If it could possibly come down in price to what other K-cups are priced, maybe I could indulge myself more. For now, it's an occasional morning treat.
customer_reviews.author: kidztales

customer_reviews.title: Twinings of London Green Tea K-Cups for Keurig is Delicious & Good for Your Health!
customer_reviews.text: The Twinings of London Green Tea K-Cups (for Keurig) come 24 pods in one box and are reasonably priced (compared to my local grocery store). My mother ordered these first and I had my tea bag of green tea in another brand. When I tried this Twinings green tea, it was very nice and not too strong. We added a teaspoon of honey to it which is also good for your health. After reading about the health benefits of green tea, we are trying to have some each day now. This tea arrived quickly in the mail...thanks!
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Spoiled Pods! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: The item was bad. The pods must have been old or exposed to heat. The taste was horrific and the pods were brick hard. Definitely spoiled in some way. Normally a product I purchase locally. The company DOES NOT offer a replacement or return. Extremely disappointed Amazon allows this to occur. Do not buy from this link. I had to throw entire pack out & lost money.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Love Green Tea
customer_reviews.text: Green tea is beneficial for many reasons including it's help in weight loss. The tea is light, flavorful, and great when I'm not feeling well. I like it best with honey rather than sugar and often indulge in it to relax on cold nights before I go to bed. Try it; I think you'll like it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Duggan

customer_reviews.title: Healthy...as a Treat
customer_reviews.text: I'm a stingy kind of person. I like value...or more specifically, a great buy. This tea is excellent in taste, strong enough in my coffee maker, but at a cost that keeps me from drinking it regularly. For that, I will buy teabags or loose tea, But as a treat and for the simplicity, this product is very good. So...quality is very good, taste is excellent, value is ok. If you can get this on sale, I would buy it. Otherwise, every once in a while, treat yourself to a good tea.
customer_reviews.author: ob1

customer_reviews.title: Like weak,tepid dishwater ..
customer_reviews.text: The last two boxes of these cake ups that I have ordered happen terrible. The tea tastes like dishwater, and weak dishwater at that. Tea should be robust, strong, and flavorful. This is none of those things. Actually poured out more than one cup into the sink rather than drink it. I had hoped that this was the result of an isolated manufacturing defect, but it appears not to be the case. Gosh, if you can’t rely upon English tea, what can you rely upon?
customer_reviews.author: GatorFan

customer_reviews.title: Don't try the Vanilla Chai Latte
customer_reviews.text: I trust the Twinnings brand, which is why i went out on a limb to get the Vanilla Chai Latte k cup. It is terrible. It reminds me of when they don't put enough flavoring at the gas station cappuccino machine. I expected bold, spicy flavor with a touch of vanilla. Instead I got murky tasteless sickly sweet sugar water.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Chai - as good as or better than Starbucks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in the hopes of finding something remotely comparable to the Chai they serve at Starbucks. I'm pleased to say that these Chai K-Cups were better than I ever hoped. The flavor is excellent and the spices are plentiful. I can get nice strong 12 oz cup and can run it through one more time for another nicely spicy but not quite as strong 12 oz. cup. I'm adding these to my Subscribe and Save!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Hammerschmidt

customer_reviews.title: More chai tea than chai latte
customer_reviews.text: I drink a chai latte just about every day. There are two types: 1) chai tea brewed and then mixed with steamed milk(Peet's Coffee) and 2) steamed milk with chai flavor added (Starbucks). It's all personal preference but I like option #2. This product is much more like option #1.
customer_reviews.author: superbeau

customer_reviews.title: wonderful  but
customer_reviews.text: The tea is wonderful and full bodied! The only problem I have been having lately is that box is getting damaged from shipping because Amazon changed from a hard outer box to a soft padded envelope!
customer_reviews.author: sammytastic

customer_reviews.title: Not your traditional way to make tea...but....
customer_reviews.text: When you just want a cup of tea and your really just want it now not in five minutes, instant tea is not the solution, your one cup brewer is, and Twinings loose none of its flavor in the making. I don't know how they did it but, my morning breakfast tea is always prefect. The nice thing is the pod has at least two good cups of tea in it. The third cup is pushing it...
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Brake

customer_reviews.title: Needs a lil doctoring
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical to get this tea based on most of the comments I read. My experience with this tea is that it works in our slightly older (maybe a couple years) keurig machine and that it tastes pretty okay with a little doctoring. Alone it is pretty bitter so if you're sensitive to that I wouldn't bother but with a little honey it tastes just fine. I enjoy it and signed up for a subscription.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Use good water.
customer_reviews.text: How to enjoy: Use quality water that you enjoy drinking. If you use the toilet water that is also available from the tap in your kitchen, this product isn’t responsible for it tasting accordingly. Don’t use tap water, and don’t use cheap bottled stuff that’s literally filtered tap water. This is good English Breakfast. If you use reclaimed chemical city water, it’s your own fault. Don’t buy the k-cups.
customer_reviews.author: Isidro

customer_reviews.title: It's creamy
customer_reviews.text: I think it's probably exactly what it's supposed to be. I thought I would like the Chai Latte better than the plain Chai. If you're looking for creamy, this will do the trick. Personally, I prefer the regular Vanilla Chai tea, but as Chai Latte goes, this is good.
customer_reviews.author: MarniTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Bold not bitter flavor, mild spicy bite.
customer_reviews.text: Due to doctor ordered special diet for a few weeks, I was looking for a replacement for my morning coffee. Not being a practicing tea drinker, I followed advice of a friend and purchased Twining black breakfast tea. Definitely not accustomed to unsweetened tea, was surprised at the mild but slightly unusual flavor, not bitter, mild spicy, very much a pleasant substitute for my regular breakfast coffee. May purchase again should the need arise.
customer_reviews.author: racelady

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good!
customer_reviews.text: I never thought k-cup tea would be good, due to the lack of sleep time, but I tried some at a hotel while traveling and found it to be shockingly good. I ordered this decaf tea because I try to minimize my caffeine intake. It's actually quite good! The taste is a bit blander than regular English breakfast, but it's perfectly drinkable and I really enjoy it with a little bit of sugar and some milk.
customer_reviews.author: clpolaszek

customer_reviews.title: ok flavor
customer_reviews.text: The flavor is ok. It hasn't jammed my Keurig needle. The cups work in my Keurig 2.0, so they have the DRM coding. I think I prefer the flavor of Celetial Seasonings Sleepytime (Amazon B004GIFMPK), but that's subjective.
customer_reviews.author: Doke Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great Stock Up item
customer_reviews.text: I subscribed to this item because I cannot always find the kcups in my stores. It was getting a little annoying so I decided to check Amazon and not only can I get a supply, but I can subscribe to have it delivered regularly to replace. It's perfect and just about the same price as if I bought in the store. Win-Win!
customer_reviews.author: ktmcbride

customer_reviews.title: Not the Twinings I am used to
customer_reviews.text: I normally purchase this directly from Twinings, but I ran out of it and ordered from Amazon since the delivery would be faster. I drink this tea daily, and I can tell you that this does NOT taste like the tea I normally drink. Additionally, each K-cup I have used so far (about 6) has not brewed properly and the tea leaves have been in my mug! I just used a different Twinings tea K-cup that I got directly from Twinings and there are no leaves in my mug. I wonder if these are defective and being resold.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Baker

customer_reviews.title: Twinings of London has upheld its standards via kcup
customer_reviews.text: I can't drink green tea, but I buy them for my relatives. They love the taste of this particular brand; they said the tea is really the best they've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: happy viewer!

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for me to subscribe to.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t find these in-store, so I bought them on Amazon sporadically. I have finally succumbed and actually subscribed so I can be confident that I won’t run out and have to emergency-order. The tea itself is a very drinkable, decaf, earl grey tea out of a Keurig machine. It’s not particularly strong, but it is perfectly acceptable when you want a cuppa earl grey in a hurry or for when you live in the Land Without Electric Kettles In Workplaces.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Murphy

customer_reviews.title: As good as it gets for a non tea drinker
customer_reviews.text: My husband drinks green tea to lower his A1C, & is not a fan of any he has tried. He tolerates this brand over the many others of bag & K-cups.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E Baird

customer_reviews.title: Great taste for us decaf drinkers!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tea. I can't have caffeine due to heart problems so this has been a great find for me. My only complaint is that they shipped it in a padded envelope instead of a box this time. The envelope doesn't keep the box of tea from getting damaged. Thankfully the pods were not damaged but they should go back to shipping them in boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Mary M

customer_reviews.title: Bland. Going back to teabag version.
customer_reviews.text: I am going back to the tea bag version which is so much more complex, richer, and overall stronger, spicier flavor than this bland K-cup. I so regret buying this.
customer_reviews.author: The Tsang Gang

customer_reviews.title: FIVE EMPTY K CUPS IN THE BOX
customer_reviews.text: I adore this tea and normally would give it a 5 star for flavor, etc. However, I had ordered several boxes in the spring and by the time I got to this one, the "return" date had passed. Actually, I didn't want to return it, but to get the full box. I'm not sure how to get the Amazon associates' attention to rectify the matter, so I will give one star for an incomplete order.
customer_reviews.author: Dawg mom

customer_reviews.title: Not Bitter
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a Black tea that I could drink black and not be bitter. This filled the wish. I need to say- Amazon delivered this in a rain storm, it sat outside for 4 hours and the box was soaked on the outside. When I opened it the insides were completely dry! I was amazed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ginger in Lemon Ginger is too overpowering.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the lemon ginger and I should have not. I do like ginger but it is too overpowering and took away from the lemon. I returned and do not recommend. But that is my personal preference. I wish in the Keurig that the flavor was more rich and bold in teas. So that is another disadvantage, but that is what you get for not using tea bags.
customer_reviews.author: Maria H.

customer_reviews.title: Delisious green tea - simple.
customer_reviews.text: Delicious tea and will keep buying for sure!! I recently started looking into the benefits of Green Tea and its weight loss advantages; I decided to give this one a try and I have to admit, no complaints at all! :) I was not paid nor did I receive any free products to review this tea! Honest feedback all the way!
customer_reviews.author: BernardTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I will not even consider repurchasing
customer_reviews.text: the tea is mis proportioned . A large cup of hot or cold tea is well over bitter. Yes you would think it could be adjusted to taste, but not so ,at least not for me. I've tried many different ways to make it palatable ,then decided I don't want to waste my time. Will not recommend or purchase agzin.
customer_reviews.author: Dogs r my fave

customer_reviews.title: taste is good but did not help me
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for me. But I have a hard time falling asleep with my sleep meds. So I drank the tea and took my sleep meds at 7pm and fell asleep at 10pm....tasted not bad and easy to make in the keurig. For me just a normal tea but not helping me with my sleep unfortunately
customer_reviews.author: momoftwo

customer_reviews.title: Bitter bitter bitter
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I have done kcup tea before and it was okay, But this is a first for me doing green tea. It’s extremely bitter, not sure what I’m gonna do with that whole box but I definitely am not gonna be able to drink it. I love green tea but that stuff is just not good.
customer_reviews.author: Nan B

customer_reviews.title: Weak :-(
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing for the price. I've measured and my favorite handmade pottery cup holds almost exactly two cups/16 oz. That's the second to the largest plus the smallest cup settings on my Keurig machine and one dark roast coffee k-cup comes out perfect. The first time I tried one of these chai latte pods I used the largest cup setting. Ugh! Super watery. Second time I did the second to largest. Still watery. It barely does the middle size without tasting watery and then I added extra milk because it wasn't very latte-like. Going back to Oregon Chai concentrates.
customer_reviews.author: ksc0967

customer_reviews.title: It would be a hard sell to make switch brands.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first decaffeinated tea that I have liked and truly enjoyed. I can't have caffeine for medical reasons and I was dreading it since my tea is very important to me. I had dreaded going tea free but when I discovered Twinings decaf, I was set. I drink mostly iced tea and the Twinings makes a beautiful, crisp ice tea.
customer_reviews.author: plant lady

customer_reviews.title: Good for the gut
customer_reviews.text: It was Tea, is was lemony, it was good. But the product is good because it's got zing! Now how much more of a sales pitch do I have to do for Jeff Bezos? He's the richest on earth currently, right? I agree with him about colonizing the solar system, but hate his Washington Post. Oh yeah, gooooood teaaaaa....
customer_reviews.author: spudboy100

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased that I went ahead and purchased them
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness, this tea is absolutely delicious. I am very pleased that I went ahead and purchased them. I was a little worried that they might be more peppermint tasting than mint/spearmint. I love spearmint tea a lot, so I was very happy when I made it and tasted that lovely spearmint flavor. Anyone would be pleased with the taste of this tea, or at least they should be in my opinion. It arrived well packaged and in perfect condition. Will definitely order again when I run out. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mildly spiced
customer_reviews.text: Winter is a great time for spiced teas. Many can be so strong they feel like they burn my tongue. When I’m out and about in the cold weather that’s fine. Sitting home at the end of the day I like something more soothing. This is a great subtle spice flavor - warming but not fiery. Customers have called it watered down. If you like strong tea, that is an apt description. For me it is a gentle bedtime tea.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Great tea!
customer_reviews.text: Always have been reluctant to use a tea K-cup. I kept thinking the coffee K cup would leave a residue and the tea would taste odd. I decided to try this green tea and it is very good. All you taste is tea!
customer_reviews.author: D. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Light flavors accentuate the tea base
customer_reviews.text: This is a very pleasant tea. Normally, with flavored stuff, you taste all flavor with a hint of tea. This tea is exactly the opposite - the base and aftertaste is tea, with light, fragrant flavors of cinnamon and clove. Delicious. I bought this on sale because I figured why not try a new box of K-cup tea for only $5? Plus, I tend to enjoy Twinings tea. I will definitely be purchasing this flavor again. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Casey May

customer_reviews.title: Just good, strong, black English Breakfast tea
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect from a kcup for tea, but this is really good. It's Twinings English Breakfast Tea, which has the bold tea flavor I love. I'm not sure what product some other people thought they were reviewing on here, but it isn't chai, isn't green, and it does not come with milk/creamer or sugar pre-added - it is just straight, black tea. If you like a good, strong cup of tea, this is what you want!
customer_reviews.author: JMED

customer_reviews.title: Delicious! But still has caffeine
customer_reviews.text: I tried this once in a sampler package and loved it so much, I now own two boxes of it. I'm really disappointed though. I can only consume caffeinated products in a careful moderation for health reasons. ALL decaffeinated products have some level of caffeine in them. This one has more than most. After 1 and a half cups, I wasn't feeling well. "Naturally decaffeinated" products are truly caffeine free. If someone were sensitive to caffeine and stimulants, I would not recommend this Chai blend for regular consumption. In a tea house, you can find Rooibos Chai which is just as good and 100% stimulant free.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Brand Of Tea
customer_reviews.text: I was born in a tea growing country and I grew up drinking tea. I have tried various brands, even expensive ones but I always find myself ordering this particular brand. It tastes really good and especially if you use a frothing machine (For the milk) with it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good for me!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really sure if this tea really calms me but I drink it at night. Taste good and the flavored creamer I use to add to it makes it taste even better! Since my diagnosis of gastric ulcers, I have to follow the dietary guidelines and that means no more caffeine - regular or decaf, no Green or Black teas, no Spearmint or Peppermint teas. The only thing left is Chamomile and this Nightly Calm teas. I also had to give up all type of carbonated drinks. So now I drink only water and tea, which is probably much better and healthier. Thank You Twinings and Amazon. It sure would be nice if there are other tea selection available.
customer_reviews.author: MysticalRoseTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Subscribe and save doesn't save you money
customer_reviews.text: Product is fine. Though I was charged for my latest shipment $2.00 more than the current cost of the product and their answer was that they charge you the amount for the same product that you paid when you first started the subscribe and save. I recommend you check your pricing monthly on subscribe and save, I just happened to notice because the cost seemed to be going up.
customer_reviews.author: NEL

customer_reviews.title: Poor Flavor--- really no flavor.
customer_reviews.text: This tea is so weak it is basically like drinking water. I have tried about half the pack thinking that maybe I just did it wrong or something the first time or two. Nope. Each pod is just as flavorless as the last. I normally love Twinings-- and still do love their bagged and lose leaf-- but their KCups are not for me.
customer_reviews.author: LondonDreaming

customer_reviews.title: Yuk!
customer_reviews.text: Bland, no flavor, and resembles dirty dish water as the other review says. I LOVE tazo chai tea from concentrate so I tried this but it was a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: brandi

customer_reviews.title: Not what we expected.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kind of coffee for certain coffee lovers. We've tried it and you have a have a certain coffee maker. My mother and aunt love it. We decided it was not for us so we keep with the normal coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Badly Made K-Cups leave Tea Leaves in your Cup
customer_reviews.text: The quality control for these pods is dreadful so I have stopped ordering it. One-third of the time, tea leaves end up in the cup making the cup undrinkable. This is unique to this brand/flavor. I don't have this problem with other brands and I am tired of pouring out cup after cup.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieInAcworth

customer_reviews.title: I cannot drink this tea
customer_reviews.text: I never drank peppermint tea before, but this was not what I thought it should taste like. I needed to drink it for IBS, but I cannot use the K-cup. Don't know why. I use the tea bag instead - Much better
customer_reviews.author: Diane Resnik

customer_reviews.title: People love this tea!
customer_reviews.text: I am the purchaser of supplies for my church, and I had picked up a box of 10 k cups because I was told, “not that many people drink tea.” That box was empty so fast, we realized how popular this tea was! So this time I bought a box of 48!!
customer_reviews.author: BlondieGal

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: Tea was super sweet and watery. Not at all creamy like some of the other Chai Tea Latte K-cups I've tried. Couldn't taste any spices, only sugar. This was more expensive than some other brands I've tried, so I was expecting a better product. Most disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Dl

customer_reviews.title: Cuppa anyone, stocked up on these!
customer_reviews.text: Really tastes like the English cuppa my English mom/ mum makes add creamer and you are aving tea with your British family. Tea is technically a meal, so instead say cuppa! Don't forget the biscuit(cookie) tin!
customer_reviews.author: BominiciousVS

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find. . Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I love Twinings teas, especially the English breakfast decaffinated that I drink in the evening. So smooth, and serves up well hot or cold. However, it is now scarce, which is probably due to COVID.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly A. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Not as I was expected
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of lemon ginger tea, ordered this often . But don’t know how this delivery without any box wrapped. Whole box of K cup was wet due to raining and damaged. Can’t drinkable , return it right away
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Defective K-cups
customer_reviews.text: The last order I received of the Twinings Chai Tea K-cups had many (about 1/3) of the K-cups that dispensed considerable grounds in the tea brew. They had to be thrown out. This, I will admit, is very unusual as I've bought many boxes of this product on Amazon and this appears to be the 1st one that was defective.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Freeman

customer_reviews.title: K cup tea
customer_reviews.text: Pag3e says I purchased this 2 times before What I remem3ber purchasing is decaf tea not regular. I think it a good tea and I will drink and enjoy it, but I did want decaf. I must order it.
customer_reviews.author: Cook55

customer_reviews.title: Weak Chai Tea Latte
customer_reviews.text: This review is for Twinings of London Chai Latte Tea K-Cups. If you are used to drinking Tazo chai tea lattes from Starbucks, you will be highly disappointed. This is a mild, lightly sweet chai tea latte. Granted, Starbucks chai is very sweet (42g of sugars in a Grande), so a bit unfair comparison to this product. Still, this tasted like drinking flavored water (I tried a few variations with the Keurig machine to see if I could make it stronger but to no avail). The search goes on for an acceptable Keurig chai tea latte....
customer_reviews.author: C. Douglas Nalbach

customer_reviews.title: Drink this and have a great night’s sleep!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for this product in all my local stores to restock my inventory; I forgot these were an Amazon purchase. This tea tastes great. I’m a 53 year old woman that has difficulty sleeping. When I drink this tea, I have a wonderful night’s sleep. My daughter is 20 years old and she says the same thing. I am re-ordering these before I forget where I bought them again!
customer_reviews.author: Sondra Vollmer

customer_reviews.title: STRONG
customer_reviews.text: these are so nice and taste delicious. i usually drink this at night to help me finish my homework, and it really does wake me up! it takes a lot of caffeine for me to actually stay awake and these do the job!
customer_reviews.author: Alexia Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Delicious tea!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tea and Amazon definitely has a great price, however, it usually comes in a box and this time it was in a soft package. The tea box was almost flat and two of the K cups were damaged. I will not continue to order from Amazon if the packaging is not sufficient to protect the product.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: If you like Green tea, this product might be the one for you.
customer_reviews.text: The product is easy to use. It's a Keurig product. I'm sure if you like green tea, there's nothing wrong with the taste. I find it a little bitter. I'm still working upon it to meet my taste satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth H.

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting green tea!
customer_reviews.text: Twinings Green Tea is great tasting and does not have any other ingredients added. This is the best price for 24 K-cups that I have found so I will be re-ordering!
customer_reviews.author: Living the dream!

customer_reviews.title: Good, sugar-free option
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to find kcups, particularly tea, that doesn’t contain sugar, so I was pleased to find these. I usually go with bag tea, but sometimes I like the convenience of cups. These have a nice spice blend and I can add sugar-free creamer if I want more of a latte-ish cup. I think my husband might just become a tea convert!
customer_reviews.author: David Hinchman

customer_reviews.title: Twinnings DECAF k-cup Earl Grey Tea.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered decaf and got the regular instead. Please have people, who are picking this pkg tea to send out, know that it is decaf instead of the regular. I’m keeping this package because my husband likes the regular. He ordered another decaf for me today!
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tea!
customer_reviews.text: I'm always skeptical about tea, but I realy trust Twinnings. I was not disappointed with Nightly Calm! I needed something to take the edge off my day and help me settle down at night. I drink a cup before bed and it really helps me find my inner peace and relaxes me just enough for sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: The bad reviews are actually correct
customer_reviews.text: No traces of chai tea. Literally, if you close your eyes and drink this "liquid" that also looks a little like dirty water, you wouldn't know the difference between normal tea and chai tea. I'm sure the brand is good with it's loose leaf tea, but this did not translate to kcups well.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Good tasting tea
customer_reviews.text: We love this tea. Ordered it and 2 days later I received it(and it was a Sunday). The only complaint I have is they just threw all 54 k-cups into a box to ship them. So I have to keep this big box as I have nothing to put all 56 of them in.
customer_reviews.author: vonda sephton

customer_reviews.title: Produces a good cup of tea.
customer_reviews.text: This provides the closest taste of bagged tea that I have liked. I use 6 ounces and get a good cup of tea. I usually double bag my teas so finding a k cup tea that I like is challenging. I have tried Irish breakfast and English breakfast and the Twinings brand has produced the best cup of tea. No bitter or astringent taste. I have tried 4 brands and really thought I would use my keurig for hot water and continue with loose or tea bags. When I tried Twinings I was satisfied enough with the k cup tea experience .
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Ok for what it is
customer_reviews.text: I love chai tea, and this is ok. However, using a Keurig doesn't allow the tea to steep at all, and so it generally comes out weak. I've tried different settings, but the water just isn't over the tea long enough to capture the full body of the flavor. I generally make this AND put a tea bag in a large cup and between the two I get a decent cup of chai. It's not a Twinnings problem, it's a brewing issue. I just wish they would've considered that before marketing it for a brewer that doesn't do their tea justice.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Z

customer_reviews.title: UGH, SO GOOD
customer_reviews.text: I basically bought a Keurig just to make chai lattes (my husband uses it for coffee but who cares). I loved Starbucks chai lattes but those things are so expensive. Compares to the Bucks chai, this tea is less sweet and less creamy. It is still incredibly delicious. I'm trying to lose weight and at 50 calories a cup, I don't feel guilty having 2. I always make the biggest size so that means it might be a little more watery than the smaller sizes and it is still great. I love that it uses natural flavors. I like to just hold my mug in my hand and inhale the smell because UGH it's just SO good.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: OK if you don't mind solids in your tea
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to this because I have always enjoyed Twinings products. Unfortunately my pack of K-cups often leaves undissolved sediment at the bottom of the cup, which even stirring doesn't always remove. I am giving it 2 stars because on those few occasions that it has produced pure liquid it is a nice cup of tea.
customer_reviews.author: Dogman

customer_reviews.title: This product will make the brewer malfunction after time
customer_reviews.text: I liked the flavour, although it has sweetener in it and I prefer my teas unsweetened. But I have been using this product at home and in the office and in both places I notice that the brewers cannot handle the consistency of the product after a while and most of the water will stay in the pod and will not make it to the cup. My brewer at home does not even let me use these particular pods anymore. It shuts off without brewing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yummy!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my favorite non-coffee K-cup. It makes a nice treat for me when I'm plowing through hours of research. One tip, though: Make sure that you run plain water through your Keurig after making this chai. Otherwise you end up with chai-flavored coffee when you brew next; also, it's better for your machine. Also, this is already lightly sweetened, so be sure to taste it before adding anything to it! I like to add a little half and half to make it creamier, but it doesn't need any sweetener at all.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie L. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great taste. Convenient way to keep stocked up for your favorite cuppa.
customer_reviews.text: Great taste, as expected. Convenient way to keep your household tea stocked. The only negative was one pod that opened up when used, perhaps the foil lid was not sealed properly to the plastic cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: dr.m

product_meta.title: Twinings of London English Breakfast Tea K-Cups for Keurig, 24 Count
product_meta.description: Style:Tea| Flavor Name:English Breakfast| Size:24 Count (Pack of 1)24 ct. Keurig English Breakfast Tea K-Cup Pods
feature_bullets: FRESH FLAVOR: One box of 24 English Breakfast Tea K-Cups. Fine black tea expertly selected from Kenya, Indonesia, Assam, Malawi and China. Using a Keurig Brewer, press the 6-oz. or 8 oz. brew button for optimal flavor.

ONLY THE FINEST QUALITY: Our expert blenders source only the finest leaves cultivated to our exacting standards by trusted growers around the world. From these tea gardens we hand-select the leaves that will shape your next Twining’s moment.

ENGLISH BREAKFAST TEA: English Breakfast is our most popular tea. To create this well-balanced blend, we carefully select the finest teas from five different regions, each with its own unique characteristics.

RICH HISTORY: In 1706 Thomas Twining began selling fine tea from an English storefront in The Strand, London. Today, Twining’s still sells some of the world's best teas from the original store and in more than 100 countries throughout the world.

HAND SELECTED FOR YOUR HOME: Made without artificial ingredients, Twining’s natural teas provide a wholesome tea experience. If you enjoy Bigelow Tea, Lipton Tea, Harney & Sons Tea, Davidson's Tea, or Prince of Peace Tea - try Twining's of London Tea.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
